seo.title: Wan 2.5 ‚Äì Audio-Ready Text & Image to Video
seo.description: Generate 5 or 10 second Wan 2.5 clips from prompts or single reference stills, complete with optional background audio and prompt expansion.

hero.title: Wan 2.5 ‚Äì Text or Image to Video with Optional Audio
hero.intro: Storyboard cinematic beats with Wan 2.5. Draft 5 or 10 second clips straight from a prompt, animate one polished still, then drop in background music for faster reviews‚Äîno manual sync required.

overview: Wan 2.5 brings Wan‚Äôs preview model into MaxVideoAI so you can iterate alongside Sora, Veo, and Kling. Swap between text-to-video and image-to-video inside one card, adjust the resolution from 480p through 1080p, and keep optional audio synced without touching an editor.

bestUseCases.title: Best use cases
items: 5 or 10 second hero beats with built-in soundtrack cues
Animating brand portraits or concept art via the image mode
Low-cost ideation at 480p before committing to 1080p renders
Localized motion tests with prompt expansion in English or Chinese

technicalOverview.label: Audio
technicalOverview.body: Optional WAV/MP3 (3‚Äì30 s, ‚â§15 MB) auto-trims to the clip length

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text prompt plus optional image (required for image-to-video)

technicalOverview.label: Prompt expansion
technicalOverview.body: Toggle LLM rewriting to add detail to short briefs

promptStructure.title: Prompt structure
promptStructure.quote: The white dragon warrior stands still as mist swirls, camera dolly-forward with a slow arc, cinematic backlighting, triumphant strings.
steps: Lead with the subject and emotional tone
Describe the camera move or pacing (slow dolly, whip-pan, loop)
Highlight key lighting or environmental cues
Call out soundtrack mood if you‚Äôre attaching audio
For image-to-video, mention what aspects must stay untouched

items: üéß Trim your WAV/MP3 to 5 or 10 seconds so Wan doesn‚Äôt discard the tail

compareLink.before: See how Wan stacks up against Sora, Veo, Kling, and Pika in our

prompts.title: Hero reveal
prompts.prompt: Gimbal push-in on a chrome concept car under soft rain, neon reflections on wet pavement, synth score swelling, 10 second runtime

prompts.title: Portrait briefing
prompts.prompt: Animate the uploaded executive portrait into a confident walk toward camera, golden hour backlight, handheld camera sway, gentle piano track

faqs.a: You can attach a WAV or MP3 up to 30 seconds. Wan trims or loops it to match the 5 or 10 second video while leaving the remainder silent.

faqs.q: Can I disable prompt expansion or the safety checker?
faqs.a: Yes. Toggle both options off when you need literal control, or leave them on for exploratory runs that benefit from additional detail.
Use 480p or 720p for cheap ideation, then rerun final clips at 1080p (billed at $0.15/s) once you‚Äôve locked the direction.

pricingNotes: Wan 2.5 bills at $0.05/s (480p), $0.10/s (720p) or $0.15/s (1080p). A 5-second 1080p render is $0.75; double it for 10 seconds.
